page.title: 02General Description 2
page.content: This is an area steeped in history.It was an important resting place for pilgrims on their way to Whithorn Abbey,it was a stopping place for the stagecoach on its way from Dumfries to Glasgow and abounds with monuments to and stories of the Covenanters.The main road is the A702 from Edinburgh to Dalry but the B729 is possibly of greater importance as it goes to Dumfries.Most people are employed in farming and forestry but a few professional people live here and the rest of the working population are either self employed builders,shop assistants in the village's 3 grocer's and post office,work in the areas 3 hotels,are employed in the electrical contractor's or travel to sundry other jobs in Dumfries.Finding employment is difficult however especially for the young and many are forced to leave.
